translation: 激活资产、升级或防火墙时必须支付该卡牌的{term:激活费用}。这些费用写在卡牌本身。

original: 1.16.9. The {term:trigger cost} of each paid ability is the first part of that ability's text. It is followed by a colon (:) and then the ability's effect. See {ref:sec_paid_abilities} for more details on paid abilities.
translation: 付费能力的{term:触发费用}是该能力的文本的第一个部分，后跟一个冒号（:），然后是该能力的效果。有关付费能力的更多细节参见{ref:sec_paid_abilities}。

original: 1.16.10. An {term:additional cost} adds something to the regular cost of initiating a particular game effect. A player must pay all additional costs along with any regular costs in order to initiate an effect.
translation: {term:额外费用}是在发起某个特定的游戏效果的常规费用之外增加的费用。玩家必须与常规费用一同支付所有的额外费用，才能发起一个效果。

original: 1.16.10.a. If a player would be forced to carry out a game effect, but doing so has an additional cost, that player may decline to pay the additional cost, even if they are able to pay it, thus preventing that effect from occurring.
translation: 如果玩家被迫使执行一个游戏效果，但这一操作具有额外费用，则该玩家可以拒绝支付该额外费用以防止该效果发生，即使其有能力支付此费用。

original: The Runner accesses {card:Obokata Protocol}. Normally the Runner must steal agendas that they access, but because {card:Obokata Protocol} has an additional cost to steal, the Runner can decline to suffer the net damage and not steal the agenda.
translation: 潜袭者读取{card:小保方协议}。通常情况下，潜袭者必须窃取其读取的议案，但由于窃取{card:小保方协议}具有额外费用，因此潜袭者可以拒绝受到网域伤害并放弃窃取议案。

original: 1.16.10.b. A player must pay all additional costs simultaneously with the cost that is being added to, even if multiple cards or abilities are adding separate additional costs. A player cannot pay the original cost or any of the additional costs individually. If they cannot pay for all of the costs at once, then they do not pay any of the costs and the corresponding effects cannot occur.
translation: 玩家在支付含有额外费用的常规费用的时必须一同支付所有的额外费用，即使多张卡牌或多项能力分别添加了不同的额外费用。玩家不能单独支付原费用，也不能单独支付任意的额外费用。如果玩家无法一次性支付所有的费用，则其不会支付任何费用，对应的效果也不能发生。

original: The Runner accesses {card:Obokata Protocol} while {card:Ben Musashi} and {card:Predictive Algorithm} are both active. The Runner must be able to pay 2 credits and suffer 6 net damage all at once in order to steal the {card:Obokata Protocol}, even though each of the three costs are from different card abilities. After all costs have been paid, abilities that meet their trigger conditions from the paying of any of those costs, such as {card:I've Had Worse} or {card:Order of Sol}, can then resolve as applicable.
translation: 潜袭者在{card:武藏弁}和{card:预测算法}都是活动状态的期间读取{card:小保方协议}。潜袭者必须能够一次性支付2信用点并受到6点网域伤害，才能窃取{card:小保方协议}，即使这三个费用来自不同的卡牌能力。在所有费用都被支付之后，触发条件因支付其中的任意费用而得到满足的能力，如{card:这还不算惨}或{card:玄晖社}，在适用时可以结算。

original: 1.16.10.c. If an additional cost is required for an effect that does not normally require paying any cost, the additional cost is paid and a checkpoint is resolved before performing the usual procedure to carry out that effect. See also {ref:rule_checkpoint_after_paying_cost}.
translation: 对于一项通常情况下并不需要支付任何费用的效果，如果其需要一个额外费用，则在执行该效果的通常流程之前，会先支付该额外费用并结算一个检查点。另请参见{ref:rule_checkpoint_after_paying_cost}。

original: The Corp is playing {card:Ob Superheavy Logistics} and initiates scoring {card:Azef Protocol}, which has an additional cost to score of "trash one of your other installed cards." If the Corp trashes a rezzed card, meeting the trigger condition for {card:Ob Superheavy Logistics}'s ability, this ability will resolve following the checkpoint associated with paying the cost. This happens before {card:Azef Protocol} is added to the Corp's score area or any trigger conditions related to scoring an agenda are met.
translation: 公司使用特性{card:鄂毕超重型物流}，并发起对{card:阿泽夫协议}的计分。将{card:阿泽夫协议}计分具有额外费用“销毁另一张你已安装的卡牌”。如果公司销毁的是一张已激活的卡牌，则将满足{card:鄂毕超重型物流}的能力的触发条件，这一能力会在与支付该费用所关联的检查点中结算。此过程会在将{card:阿泽夫协议}加入公司分数区、以及任何与计分议案有关的触发条件得到满足之前发生。

original: 1.16.11. A {term:nested cost} is a cost appearing within an ability's instructions that must be paid while the ability is resolving in order for some or all of the rest of the effects of that ability to resolve.
translation: {term:内部费用}是出现在能力的指示中的费用。在结算该能力期间，该能力的其他效果中的部分或全部必须在该内部费用被支付之后才能结算。

original: 1.16.11.a. Nested costs are usually written in the format "[player] may [cost] to [instructions]" or "[player] may [cost]. If [you/they] do, [instructions]." If the indicated player pays the indicated cost, the indicated instructions are resolved. Otherwise, that part of the ability is not resolved.
translation: 内部费用通常写作“[玩家]可以支付[费用]以[指示]”或“[玩家]可以支付[费用]。如果[你/其]如此做，[指示]。”的形式。如果费用中指定的玩家支付了指定的费用，则会结算指定的指示。否则，能力中的该部分不会结算。

original: 1.16.11.b. Nested costs can also be written in the format "[instructions] unless [player] [cost]" or "[player] may [cost]. If [you/they] do not, [instructions]." If the indicated player pays the indicated cost, the indicated instructions are not resolved. Otherwise, that instruction is resolved.
translation: 内部费用也可以写作“[指示]除非[玩家]支付[费用]”或“[玩家]可以支付[费用]。如果[你/其]未如此做，[指示]。”的形式。如果指定的玩家支付了指定的费用，则指定的指示不会结算，否则该指示会结算。

original: A subroutine reading "End the run unless the Runner pays 1[c]." contains a nested cost. If the Runner chooses to pay 1[c], the subroutine will not end the run.
translation: 一条内容为“终止本次潜袭，除非潜袭者支付1[c]。”的子进程包含一个内部费用。如果潜袭者选择支付1[c]，则该子进程不会终止本次潜袭。

original: 1.16.11.c. An ability that reads "If [you/they] do" or "If [you/they] do not" without a preceding "may" does not indicate a nested cost.
translation: 内容为“如果[你/其]如此做”或“如果[你/其]未如此做”，但前面没有“可以”的能力并不表示一个内部费用。

original: 1.16.11.d. Some abilities use the word "otherwise" to indicate that different instructions should be resolved depending on whether a nested cost was paid or not. In an ability with a nested cost of a form described in {ref:rule_nested_cost_may}, treat "otherwise" as an "if [you/they] do not" clause attached to the same cost. Conversely, in an ability with a nested cost of a form described in {ref:rule_nested_cost_unless}, treat "otherwise" as an "if [you/they] do" clause attached to the same cost. Note that "otherwise" can also appear in the context of other types of conditions, and does not by itself indicate a nested cost.
translation: 一些能力会使用用语“否则”表示根据内部费用的支付与否应结算不同的指示。在拥有形式如规则{ref:rule_nested_cost_may}所述的内部费用的能力中，“否则”视为带有相同费用的“如果[你/其]未如此做”分句。反之，在带有形式如规则{ref:rule_nested_cost_unless}所述的内部费用的能力中，“否则”视为带有相同费用的“如果[你/其]如此做”分句。注意“否则”也可以出现在其它类型条件的上下文当中，其本身并不表示一个内部费用。

original: 1.17. Score, Scoring and Stealing
translation: 分数、计分与窃取

original: 1.17.1. The sum of all agenda points on agendas in a player's score area is that player's {term:score}.
translation: 玩家的分数区中所有议案的议案分数总和即为该玩家的{term:分数}。

original: 1.17.1.a. The {term:threat level} is equal to the greatest score of any player. The "Threat N" ability flag makes use of the threat level ({ref:rule_threat_flag}).
translation: {term:威胁等级}等于所有玩家的分数中的最大值。能力标记“威胁N”会使用威胁等级，参见{ref:rule_threat_flag}。

original: If the Runner's score is 4 agenda points, and the Corp's score is 3 agenda points, the threat level is 4.
translation: 如果潜袭者的分数为4点议案分数，而公司的分数为3点议案分数，则威胁等级为4。

original: 1.17.2. If at any time a player's score is greater than or equal to 7, they win the game at the next checkpoint. See {ref:sec_ending_the_game} regarding winning the game, and {ref:sec_checkpoints} for details about checkpoints.
translation: 在任意时间，如果一名玩家的分数大于或等于7，则该玩家在下一个检查点赢得游戏胜利。有关获得游戏胜利的内容参见{ref:sec_ending_the_game}，有关检查点的详细描述参见{ref:sec_checkpoints}。

original: 1.17.3. Players add agendas to their score areas by {term:scoring} or {term:stealing} them. The Corp can score an agenda to their score area as an option during certain paid ability windows on their turn. The Runner can steal an agenda to their score area while accessing it.
translation: 玩家通过{term:计分}或{term:窃取}将议案加入其分数区。公司可以在其回合的某些付费能力窗口中选择将议案计分并加入其分数区。潜袭者可以在读取议案时窃取该议案并加入其分数区。

original: 1.17.3.a. The {term:advancement requirement} of an agenda restricts when the Corp can score it. The Corp can only score an agenda that has advancement counters on it greater than or equal to its advancement requirement. See {ref:sec_advancing_cards}.
translation: 议案的{term:推进需求}限制了公司何时可以将其计分。只有在议案上拥有超过或等于其推进需求的推进指示物时，公司才能将其计分。参见{ref:sec_advancing_cards}。

original: 1.17.3.b. The Corp is not required to score an agenda immediately upon satisfying its advancement requirement.
translation: 公司并不需要在满足议案的推进需求时便立即将其计分。

original: 1.17.3.c. Scoring an agenda does not cost [click] and is not an action.
translation: 计分议案既不需要花费[click]，也不是一个行动。

original: 1.17.3.d. The Runner cannot decline to steal an agenda they access, unless there is an additional cost to steal that agenda and the Runner cannot or does not wish to pay it. {ref:Chpt_access_breach} details accessing, and {ref:rule_additional_cost} details additional costs.
translation: 潜袭者不能拒绝窃取其读取的议案，除非窃取该议案具有额外费用而潜袭者无法支付或不愿支付。有关读取的详细描述参见{ref:Chpt_access_breach}，有关额外费用的详细描述参见{ref:rule_additional_cost}。

original: 1.17.3.e. If an effect directly adds an agenda to a score area or otherwise moves an agenda from any zone to a score area, that agenda is not considered scored or stolen.
translation: 如果一个效果直接将一个议案加入分数区，或是将一个议案从任意区域转移至分数区，则该议案既不会被视作被计分也不会被视作被窃取。

original: 1.17.3.f. If an effect causes another card to be added to a score area "as an agenda", the newly converted agenda is not considered scored or stolen. See {ref:rule_add_card_to_score_area}.
translation: 如果一个效果导致另一张卡牌“作为一个议案”被加入分数区，则新转化的议案既不会被视作被计分也不视作被窃取。参见{ref:rule_add_card_to_score_area}。

original: 1.17.4. Agendas are always added to the score area faceup, regardless of their previous faceup/facedown status.
translation: 议案总是牌面朝上加入分数区，无论其先前的状态是牌面朝上还是牌面朝下。

original: 1.17.5. If an installed agenda is scored or stolen, it becomes uninstalled. Any advancement counters on the scored or stolen agenda are returned to the bank. See {ref:rule_trash_hosted_objects_when_host_trashed}.
translation: 如果一个已安装的议案被计分或窃取，则该议案被卸载。被计分或窃取的议案上的所有推进指示物都返回银行。参见{ref:rule_trash_hosted_objects_when_host_trashed}。

original: 1.17.6. Some agendas and other cards have abilities with a trigger condition related to an agenda being scored. These abilities become pending after the Corp moves the agenda from its current zone to their score area.
translation: 一些议案与其他卡牌的能力带有与计分议案相关的触发条件。这些能力会在公司将议案从当前区域转移至其分数区后变为待定。

original: 1.17.7. Some agendas and other cards have abilities with a trigger condition related to an agenda being stolen. These abilities become pending after the Runner moves the agenda from its current zone to their score area.
translation: 一些议案与其他卡牌的能力带有与窃取议案相关的触发条件。这些能力会在潜袭者将议案从当前区域转移至其分数区后变为待定。

original: 1.17.8. If an ability meets its trigger condition from an agenda being scored or stolen, the agenda's last known number of advancement counters before being scored or stolen is used for any references to the number of advancement counters in the effects of that ability.
translation: 如果一项能力因一个议案被计分或窃取而满足其触发条件，则该能力的效果中所有涉及推进指示物数量之处，均以该议案在被计分或窃取前最后已知的推进指示物数量为准。

original: 1.18. Advancing Cards
translation: 推进卡牌

original: 1.18.1. To {term:advance} a card is to place an advancement counter from the bank on it. The Corp typically advances cards with a basic action during their action phase, but card abilities can also advance cards.
translation: {term:推进}一张卡牌指的是从银行放置一枚推进指示物到该卡牌上。公司通常是在其行动阶段中使用基础行动推进卡牌，但卡牌能力也可以推进卡牌。

original: 1.18.2. Resolving an instruction that directly places an advancement counter onto a card is not the same as advancing a card. Likewise, resolving an instruction that moves an advancement counter from one card to another is not the same as advancing a card.
translation: 结算一项直接将推进指示物放置到一张卡牌上的指示并不等同于推进一张卡牌。类似地，结算一项将推进指示物从一张卡牌转移到另一张卡牌的指示也不等同于推进一张卡牌。

original: The Corp plays {card:Mushin No Shin}, choosing to install an {card:Oaktown Renovation}. Because the three advancement counters were placed on the card directly, the Corp does not gain any credits from the ability on {card:Oaktown Renovation}.
translation: 公司打出{card:无心之心}，选择安装{card:革新奥克敦}。由于三枚推进指示物是被直接放置在{card:革新奥克敦}上的，因此公司不会通过其能力获得任何信用点。

original: 1.18.3. The Corp can only advance certain installed cards. Agendas can always be advanced. If a card other than an agenda says that it "can be advanced" or that "you can advance" that card, the card can be advanced even while it is unrezzed. There is no limit to the number of times a card can be advanced.
translation: 公司只能推进某些已安装的卡牌。议案总是可以被推进。如果一张非议案卡牌上写有该卡牌“可以被推进”或“你可以推进”该卡牌，则这张卡牌也可以被推进，即使其尚未激活。一张卡牌可以被推进的次数没有限制。

original: 1.18.4. An "advanced card" is a card with 1 or more advancement counters hosted on it.
translation: “已推进的卡牌”指的是被1枚或更多的推进指示物所附载的卡牌。

original: 1.19. Trashing
translation: 销毁

original: 1.19.1. {term:Trashing} is the act of moving an object to its owner's discard pile.
translation: {term:销毁}指的是将一个物件转移至其所有者的弃牌堆的行为。

original: 1.19.2. During access, the Runner has the opportunity to pay the trash cost of the accessed card to trash it. See {ref:rule_basic_trash_ability}.
translation: 在读取的过程中，潜袭者有机会支付被读取的卡牌的销毁费用以将其销毁。参见{ref:rule_basic_trash_ability}。

original: 1.19.3. A trashed card is not considered to have been discarded, and vice versa. Cards that prevent a card from being trashed cannot prevent a card from being discarded.
translation: 被销毁的卡牌并不会被视作被弃除，反之亦然。防止一张卡牌被销毁并不能防止这张卡牌被弃除。

original: 1.19.4. The symbol [trash] represents trashing the object it appears on. It is used as a cost for certain abilities.
translation: 符号[trash]表示销毁其所在的物件。这个符号会被用作某些能力的费用。

original: {card:Fall Guy}'s last ability reads "[trash]: Gain 2[c]." The cost to trigger this ability is to trash {card:Fall Guy}.
translation: {card:替罪羊}的最后一个能力的内容为“[trash]: 获得2[c]”。触发此能力的费用是销毁{card:替罪羊}。

original: 1.19.4.a. "A [trash] ability" refers to a paid ability that includes [trash] in its trigger cost.
translation: “[trash]能力”指的是在其触发费用中包含[trash]的付费能力。

original: 1.19.4.b. Some paid abilities have multiple options for their trigger cost, separated by "or". A player triggering such an ability only "used a [trash] ability" if the actual cost that was paid includes [trash].
translation: 一些付费能力的触发费用是多个由“或”分隔的选项。当玩家触发此类能力时，只有当实际被支付的费用包含[trash]时，才被视作“使用了一个[trash]能力”。

original: 1.20. Memory
translation: 内存

original: 1.20.1. A {term:memory unit} ([MU]) is a space available to the Runner to install programs.
translation: {term:内存单元}（[MU]）是潜袭者可用于安装程序的空间。

original: 1.20.2. The Runner's {term:memory limit} is the total amount of [MU] the Runner has. If the Runner's identity card does not specify a starting memory limit, their starting memory limit is 4[MU]. An ability of the form "+N[MU]" increases the Runner's memory limit by N[MU].
translation: 潜袭者的{term:内存上限}是其拥有的[MU]的总和。如果潜袭者的特性卡牌并未指定初始内存上限，则其初始内存上限为4[MU]。形式为“+N[MU]”的能力会将潜袭者的内存上限增加N[MU]。

original: The Runner is playing an identity with a starting memory limit of 4[MU]. They have an installed copy of {card:T400 Memory Diamond}, which has the ability "+1[MU]". The Runner can therefore have up to 5[MU] worth of programs installed.
translation: 潜袭者使用的特性具有4[MU]的初始内存上限。该玩家安装了一张{card:T400记忆钻石}，该卡牌具有能力“+1[MU]“。因此潜袭者可以安装合计占用最多为5[MU]的程序。

original: 1.20.3. Programs have a {term:memory cost} that is continually applied against the memory limit. {ref:Rule_program_memory_cost} details how the Runner's installed programs are constrained by the memory limit.
translation: 程序拥有{term:内存费用}，该费用会持续占用内存上限。有关潜袭者已安装的程序如何受到内存上限的的限制，参见{ref:Rule_program_memory_cost}。

original: 1.20.4. Some abilities give the Runner [MU] that can only be used for programs that meet a given requirement.
translation: 一些能力会给予潜袭者[MU]，但这些[MU]只能被用于满足了给定条件的程序。

original: 1.20.4.a. If a calculated value refers directly to the Runner's memory limit or to their unused [MU], that calculation ignores requirements about how that [MU] can be filled.
translation: 如果一个计算出的数值直接涉及潜袭者的内存上限或其剩余的[MU]，则该计算过程会忽略使用上述[MU]的要求。

original: 1.20.4.b. To determine if the Runner's installed programs satisfy the restrictions on their [MU], create a mapping that assigns each 1[MU] in the memory cost of each installed program to a specific source (either the Runner's starting memory limit or an ability providing additional [MU]). The total [MU] assigned to each source must not exceed the amount of [MU] it provides, and all programs with [MU] assigned to a given source must meet all restrictions imposed on that [MU]. If it is not possible to create such a mapping, the Runner is considered to have exceeded their memory limit, and they must trash installed programs as described in {ref:rule_program_memory_cost}.
translation: 为确定潜袭者已安装的程序是否满足对其[MU]的限制，需要创建一个映射：对每个已安装的程序，将其内存费用中的每1[MU]分配给一个特定的来源（无论是潜袭者的初始内存上限还是由能力提供的额外[MU]）。分配给每个来源的总[MU]不能超过该来源所提供的[MU]的数量，且对于被分配到给定来源的[MU]，拥有这些[MU]的所有程序都必须满足施加在该[MU]上的限制。如果无法建立起这样的映射，则潜袭者被视作超过了其内存上限，且必须依照{ref:rule_program_memory_cost}中所述销毁已安装的程序。

original: 1.21. Card Visibility
translation: 卡牌可见性

original: 1.21.1. Cards in the play area and other public zones are either {term:faceup} or {term:facedown}. Faceup cards are freely visible to all players. Facedown cards are oriented so that the face containing the card's information is not visible.
translation: 游戏区及其他公开区域中的卡牌只能是{term:牌面朝上}或{term:牌面朝下}。牌面朝上的卡牌对所有玩家都是可见的。牌面朝下的卡牌则应翻转，使其包含卡牌信息的一面不可见。

original: 1.21.1.a. Cards in hidden or secret zones (see {ref:sec_game_zones_general}) are neither faceup nor facedown.
translation: 隐藏区域和秘密区域（参见{ref:sec_game_zones_general}）中的卡牌既不是牌面朝上的也不是牌面朝下的。

original: 1.21.1.b. Some effects host multiple cards on an object at the same time or set aside multiple cards at the same time. Facedown cards that enter a zone at the same time by the same effect are treated as a group. See {ref:rule_host_faceup_facedown} and {ref:rule_facedown_set_aside_distinct_groups}, respectively.
translation: 一些效果能够将多张卡牌同时附载到一个物件上，或者同时将多张卡牌置于一旁。因同一效果同时进入某个区域的所有牌面朝下的卡牌被视为一个组。分别参见{ref:rule_host_faceup_facedown}和{ref:rule_facedown_set_aside_distinct_groups}。

original: 1.21.2. When a player {term:looks} at a card, they are allowed to see the front face of the card even if the front face would not normally be visible to them. A player should look at that card without showing it to the other player if it is not normally visible to that player.
translation: 当一位玩家{term:查看}一张卡牌时，该玩家被允许查看该卡牌的正面，即使在通常情况下该卡牌的正面对其并不可见。如果该卡牌通常情况下对另一位玩家并不可见，则玩家在查看该卡牌时不能将其展示给另一位玩家。

original: 1.21.2.a. A player may look at facedown cards they control at any time.
translation: 玩家可以在任意时间查看其操控的牌面朝下的卡牌。

original: 1.21.3. To {term:reveal} a card is to show its front face to all players, then return it to its previous state.
translation: {term:展示}一张卡牌指的是将其正面展示给所有玩家，然后将其恢复到其先前的状态。

original: 1.21.4. Some abilities instruct the Runner to {term:expose} one or more cards. To expose a card is to reveal it, except that only installed, unrezzed cards can be exposed.
translation: 一些能力会指示潜袭者{term:揭示}一张或多张卡牌。揭示一张卡牌即展示该卡牌，区别在于只有已安装且未激活的卡牌可以被揭示。

original: 1.21.5. Effects that instruct a player to look at, reveal, expose, or access a card are not the same, even if they would be performed similarly at times. See {ref:chpt_access_breach} for more information on accessing.
translation: 指示玩家查看、展示、揭示或读取一张卡牌的效果是不同的，即使有时其执行的行为是类似的。有关读取的更多信息参见{ref:chpt_access_breach}。

original: 1.21.6. If a resolving ability directs one or both players to look at or reveal a card or set of cards, each such card remains visible to the relevant player(s) until the entire ability is finished resolving or the card moves to a different location. {n}See also {ref:rule_visibility_after_access}.{/n}
translation: 如果某个正在结算的能力指示其中一位或双方玩家查看或展示一张或一组卡牌，则在该能力全部完成结算或是这些卡牌被转移至另一个位置之前，每张这样的卡牌对相关的玩家都保持可见。{n}另请参见{ref:rule_visibility_after_access}。{/n}

original: 1.21.7. The ability "While the Runner is accessing this [type] in R&D, they must reveal it." is a static ability that applies for the entire duration of the access. This is also the case for cards with the older wording, "If [this card] is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it."
translation: 能力“在潜袭者从研发中心读取本[卡牌类型]的期间，其必须展示之。”是在整个读取的持续时间当中都生效的持续能力。同样的情况也适用于较早版本的用语“如果[这张卡牌]从研发中心被读取，潜袭者必须展示之”。
